title: 105_hr4199
content: The "Laurie Beechman Ovarian Cancer Commemorative Coin Act" authorizes the minting of $1 silver coins with specific specifications. The coins will weigh 26.73 grams, have a diameter of 1.500 inches, and contain 90 percent silver and 10 percent copper. The coins will be legal tender and considered numismatic items. The silver for minting the coins will be obtained from stockpiles established under the Strategic and Critical Materials Stock Piling Act. SEC. 4. DESIGN OF COINS. The design of the coins minted under this Act shall be emblematic of Laurie Beechman, her struggle against ovarian cancer, and her accomplishments. Each coin shall bear inscriptions of value, dates, and national symbols. The likeness of Laurie Beechman will be on the obverse side. The design will be selected by the Secretary after consultation with the Commission of Fine Arts. Each coin shall bear inscriptions of value, dates, and national symbols. The likeness of Laurie Beechman will be on the obverse side. The design will be selected by the Secretary after consultation with the Commission of Fine Arts and reviewed by the Citizens Commemorative Coin Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS. Coins minted under this Act will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities from a single designated facility. The Secretary can start issuing the coins promptly, but minting must cease by December 31, 1999. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. The coins will be sold by the Secretary at a price including face value, a surcharge, and the cost of designing and issuing. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted with a reasonable discount. All sales will include a $9 surcharge per coin. SEC. 7. GENERAL WAIVER OF PROCUREMENT REGULATIONS. No procurement laws apply to goods and services needed for this Act, except for equal employment opportunity laws. SEC. 8. DISTRIBUTION OF SURCHARGES. Surcharges from coin sales will be paid to Gilda's Club, Incorporated for ovarian cancer battle purposes. The Comptroller General can audit the club's expenditures. SEC. 9. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. SEC. 9. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. The Secretary must ensure no net cost to the government for minting coins and require full payment, security, or a guarantee for issued coins.
